item.title: Report E-2025060495
item.description:
Report E-2025060495

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-21
  • City: HAZEN
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MC Tank Transport Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2025, at 23:36 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by MC Tank Transport personnel in Hazen, AR regarding the release of o-Cresol. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 2.0 pints of o-Cresol (UN3455, 6.1(8), II) from (1) tanker trailer into a bucket. The release was slowly dripping from the unit and captured in a 5-gallon bucket. Any impact on the ground had dried before the contractorâ€™s arrival. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Contractors assisted with a tank transfer to ensure no further release. No waste was generated from addressing this release.

item.title: Report E-2025060469
item.description:
Report E-2025060469

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-20
  • City: FORREST CITY
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2025, one (1) 265-gallon tote of UN3266 was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents to remediate the site. The contents of the tote were transferred to one (1) new 265-gallon tote. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025070099
item.description:
Report E-2025070099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: ARKADELPHIA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 310000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: A Veolia truck was transporting a roll off box of residual incinerator ash from Veolia, Port Arthur, Texas to the Veolia, Gum Springs, AR landfill for disposal. While travelling around a curve on Highway 26 near the 300 block the vehicle veered out of its designated travel lane and onto the right shoulder. The driver then over corrected to the left, causing the vehicle to overturn onto its right side. During the incident, the hazardous materials container detached from the vehicle and released its contents onto the roadway, shoulder, and adjacent ditch. In addition, the truck leaked diesel fuel, hydraulic fluid, and other hazardous substances into the ditch. The Veolia driver was transported to the hospital via ambulance and was released shortly after with minor injuries.

item.title: Report E-2025060371
item.description:
Report E-2025060371

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: SEARCY
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4605
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to completely empty the delivery hose before disconnecting it from the trailer. As a result, approximately 2 gallons of sodium hydroxide solution was spilled. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025071376
item.description:
Report X-2025071376

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 1 plastic bottle, loose of defective top. Nu-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner #4291-08, wrapped in a plastic bag, overwrapped in a plastic FedEx Padded Pak then placed in a fiberboard box. UN3266 Corrosive liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s.(Sodium Hydroxide), Class 8, PGII////Shipment is being held for FAA investigation.
